oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Folding knife with marlin spike
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: This folding knife features a blade and a marlin spike. It was made by "ROBERTS / SHEFFIELD" as stamped on the heel of the knife blade. The scales appear to be of a black synthetic material. This was the typical pocket knife of the British soldier into the 1950s. It belonged to Pvt. James McFerren Johnston, HQ Co., Ord. Corps and he was attached to the 114th MG Battn., 30th Div. The 30th Div. served under British command during their time in Europe and often received British items.
